children.text:
►Orientation
 Time (whats the time now?) Person place (where are you?) • alert
 • lethargic, depressed
 • unconsciousness
 ►Mood:
 • anxious,depressed
 ►Handedness
 ►Abnormal posture
 ►Abnormal gait
 ►Neck:
 • stiff,bruit
 ►Face:
 • lack of expression
 • Asymmetry
 ►Speech and language

►Unilateral foot drop 
 
 • Unilateral LMNL
 • Lision in (sciatic or commen peronial n.)
 
 ►High steppage gait 
 
 
 • Bilateral LMNL
 • (Polyneuropathy,gullian barri)
 
 ►Hemiplegic gait
 
 • Characterized by leg extension at the knee and ankle
 • shoulder abduction, elbow flexion 
 • circumduction at the hip
 • semicircle as the patient walks
 • due to a unilateral upper motor neurone lesion
 
 ► Scissor-like gait
 
 • Causes Bilateral upper motor neurone damage 
 • due to spasticity
 
 ►Ataxic gait 
 
 • Broad-based
 • unsteady (ataxic) gait
 • walking heel to toe in a straight line is impossible
 • due to Cerebellar dysfunction
 
 ► Shuffling gait
 
 • Initiation of walking may be delayed
 • steps are short and shuffling
 • loss/reduction of arm swing
 • impairment of postural reflexes 
 • rapid short-stepped hurrying gait 
 • Turning involves many short steps, 
 • with the risk of unsteadiness and falls
 • In Parkinsonism 
 
 ► Waddling gait 
 
 • Occur in Proximal muscle weakness 
 
 ► Bizarre gaits
 
 • Associated with Huntington's disease
